Semantics

This interface is for managing this particular bundle's semantic bindings -- especially (but not limited to) bindings for schema created by this bundle. If, for example, this bundle creates a animals table, it might also create semantic bindings that setup default display and edit widgets for that table that override the primitive type handlers. Much to design here.

Connection string

Connection strings must be in Paramater Keywords format (no connection URIs) because postgres_fdw is dumb. See (syntax documentation).

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    <head>

        <title>Aquameta</title>
        <script src='/system.js'></script>
        

        <!--semantic ui + themes + style switcher -->
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.superhero.min.css" rel="alternate stylesheet" title="superhero">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.darkly.min.css"    rel="alternate stylesheet" title="darkly">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.lumen.min.css"     rel="alternate stylesheet" title="light">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.slate.min.css"     rel="alternate stylesheet" title="dark">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/semantic-ui@2.4.2/dist/semantic.min.css">
        <script type="text/javascript" src="/assets/js/styleswitcher.js"></script>

        <!-- for documentation manager -->
	    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/markdown-it/8.4.2/markdown-it.min.js"></script>
        
        <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width">
    </head>
    <body></body>
    <script>
        System.import('/widget.js').then(function(widget) {
            System.import('/semantic.min.js').then(function(s) {

                var db = new AQ.Database('/endpoint/0.3', { evented: 'no' });
                window.endpoint = db;

                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.core.ide', 'ide', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.layout', 'layout', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.tags', 'tag', db);

                $('body').append(widget('ide:bundle'));
                $('body').append(widget('ide:debugger_manager'));
                $('body').append(widget('ide:status_handler'));
            });
        });
    </script>
</html>

Welcome!

If you can see this, you have successfully installed Aquameta!

Dependencies

Widget dependencies are Javascript libraries/snippets/etc that are executed each time this widget is loaded on the screen, before html is rendered or post_js is executed. It's a good spot for commonly used Javascript libraries, often times used by more than one widget. Guy says:
  • add as version ranges, name and major/minor/patch, w/ lock options
  • use jspm to work out import map
  • question: use es vs system? could do a system conversion in the background.
  • https://ga.system.jspm.io for system?

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
    <head>

        <title>Aquameta</title>
        <script src='/system.js'></script>
        
        <!--semantic ui + themes + style switcher -->
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.superhero.min.css" rel="alternate stylesheet" title="superhero">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.darkly.min.css"    rel="alternate stylesheet" title="darkly">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.lumen.min.css"     rel="alternate stylesheet" title="light">
        <link href="/assets/css/semantic.slate.min.css"     rel="alternate stylesheet" title="dark">
        
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/semantic-ui@2.4.2/dist/semantic.min.css">
        <script type="text/javascript" src="/assets/js/styleswitcher.js"></script>
        
        <!-- for documentation manager -->
	    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/markdown-it/8.4.2/markdown-it.min.js"></script>
        
        <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width">
    </head>
    <body></body>
    <script>
        System.import('/widget.js').then(function(widget) {
            System.import('/semantic.min.js').then(function(s) {

                var db = new AQ.Database('/endpoint/0.3', { events: false });
                window.endpoint = db;

                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.core.ide', 'ide', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.layout', 'layout', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.tags', 'tag', db);

                $('body').append(widget('ide:base', { content: widget('ide:bundles') }));
                $('body').append( widget('ide:debugger_manager'));
            });
        });
    </script>
</html>

<html lang="en">
    <head>

        <title>Aquameta</title>
        <script src='/system.js'></script>
        
        <!--semantic ui + themes + style switcher -->
        
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/semantic-ui@2.4.2/dist/semantic.min.css">
        <script type="text/javascript" src="/assets/js/styleswitcher.js"></script>
        
        <!-- for documentation manager -->
	    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/markdown-it/8.4.2/markdown-it.min.js"></script>
        
        <meta http-equiv="Content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width">
    </head>
    <body></body>
    <script>
        System.import('/widget.js').then(function(widget) {
            System.import('/semantic.min.js').then(function(s) {

                var db = new AQ.Database('/endpoint/0.3', { evented: 'no' });
                window.endpoint = db;

                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.core.ide', 'ide', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.layout', 'layout', db);
                AQ.Widget.import('org.aquameta.ui.tags', 'tag', db);

                $('body').append(widget('ide:index'));
                $('body').append(widget('ide:debugger_manager'));

            });
        });
    </script>
</html>
